content: 4 And David said unto him— How turned out the matter? tell me､ I pray thee. And he said— The people have fled from the battle､ Yea moreover, many of the people have fallen､ and died, Yea moreover, Saul､ and Jonathan his son are dead.

content: 14 And David said unto him,— How wast thou not afraid to thrust forth thy hand, to destroy the Anointed of Yahweh?

content: 16 And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thine own head,—for thine own mouth hath testified against thee､ saying, I myself put to death the Anointed of Yahweh.

content: 20 Do not tell it in Gath, Do not publish it in the streets of Ashkelon,— Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, Lest the daughters of the Uncircumcised triumph.

content: 21 Ye mountains in Gilboa! Be there neither dew nor rain upon you､ Nor fields of offerings,— For there were cast away､ the shields of the mighty, The shield of Saul, unanointed with oil.

content: 22 From the blood of the slain､ From the fat of the mighty The bow of Jonathan ne’er drew back,— And the sword of Saul ne’er returned empty.

content: 23 Saul and Jonathan Delightfully loving in their lives, Even in their death were not divided,— Beyond eagles were they swift, Beyond lions were they strong!

content: 24 Ye daughters of Israel! For Saul weep ye,— Who clothed you in crimson､ decked with lovely things, Who hung ornaments of gold on your apparel!

content: 25 How have fallen the mighty, in the midst of the battle! Jonathan on thy high places slain!

content: 26 I am distressed for thee､ my brother､ Jonathan! Delightful to me､ exceedingly,— Wonderful was thy love to me, passing the love of women.

content: 1 And it came to pass after this that David enquired of Yahweh､ saying— Shall I go up into one of the cities of Judah? And Yahweh said unto him､ Go up. And David said— Whithershall I go up? And he said— Unto Hebron.

content: 2 So David went up thither, and his two wives also,—Ahinoam､ the Jezreelitess, and Abigail､ wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
content_old: 2 So David went up thither, and his two wives also,—Ahinoam､ the Jezreelitess, and Abigail､ wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

content: 3 His men also who were with him did David bring up､ every man with his household,—and they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.
content_old: 3 His men also who were with him did David bring up､ every man with his household,—and they dwelt in the cities of Hebron.

content: 5 So David sent messengers unto the men of Jabesh-gilead,—and said unto them— Blessed be ye of Yahweh, that ye did this lovingkindness unto your lord､ unto Saul, and buried him.

content: 6 Now therefore､ Yahweh requite you with lovingkindness and truth,—moreover also I will requite you､ for this noble deed, in that ye did this thing.

content: 7 Now therefore､ let your hands be made firm､ and become ye sons of valour, for your lord Saul is dead,—and me moreover have the house of Judah anointed､ to be king over them.

content: 8 But Abner son of Ner, prince of the host that pertained unto Saul took Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, and brought him over to Mahanaim;
content_old: 8 But Abner son of Ner, prince of the host that pertained unto Saul took Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, and brought him over to Mahanaim;

content: 9 and made him king for Gilead, and for the Ashurites､ and for Jezreel,—and over Ephraim､ and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
content_old: 9 and made him king for Gilead, and for the Ashurites､ and for Jezreel,—and over Ephraim､ and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.

content: 10 Forty years old was Ish-bosheth son of Saul､ when he began to reign over Israel, and two years reigned he,—but the house of Judah followed David.
content_old: 10 Forty years old was Ish-bosheth son of Saul､ when he began to reign over Israel, and two years reigned he,—but the house of Judah followed David.

content: 11 And it came to pass､ that the number of the days that David was king in Hebron､ over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass､ that the number of the days that David was king in Hebron､ over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.

content: 12 And Abner son of Ner, and the servants of Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, came out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.
content_old: 12 And Abner son of Ner, and the servants of Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, came out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

content: 13 And Joab son of Zeruiah､ and the servants of David went out from Hebron and met､ by the pool of Gibeon､ together,—and they sat down､ these by the pool､ on the one side, and those by the pool､ on the other side.
content_old: 13 And Joab son of Zeruiah､ and the servants of David went out from Hebron and met､ by the pool of Gibeon､ together,—and they sat down､ these by the pool､ on the one side, and those by the pool､ on the other side.

content: 14 Then said Abner unto Joab, Let the young men arise､ I pray thee､ and make sport before us. And Joab said— Let them arise.
content_old: 14 Then said Abner unto Joab, Let the young men arise､ I pray thee､ and make sport before us. And Joab said— Let them arise.

content: 15 Then there arose､ and went over by number,—twelve of Benjamin､ pertaining to Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, and twelve､ of the servants of David.
content_old: 15 Then there arose､ and went over by number,—twelve of Benjamin､ pertaining to Ish-bosheth､ son of Saul, and twelve､ of the servants of David.

content: 16 And they caught every one his fellow by the head､ with his sword in his fellow’s side, so they fell､ together,—and that place was called Helkath-hazzadin ､ which is in Gibeon.

content: 17 So the battle became exceeding obstinate､ on that day,—and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated before the servants of David.
content_old: 17 So the battle became exceeding obstinate､ on that day,—and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated before the servants of David.

content: 18 Now there were there､ three sons of Zeruiah, Joab､ and Abishai､ and Asahel,—and Asahel was light of foot as a wild gazelle.
content_old: 18 Now there were there､ three sons of Zeruiah, Joab､ and Abishai､ and Asahel,—and Asahel was light of foot as a wild gazelle.

content: 19 And Asahel pursued Abner,—and turned not､ in going､ to the right hand or to the left, from pursuing Abner.
content_old: 19 And Asahel pursued Abner,—and turned not､ in going､ to the right hand or to the left, from pursuing Abner.

content: 20 Then Abner looked behind him, and said— Art thou Asahel? And he said— I am.
content_old: 20 Then Abner looked behind him, and said— Art thou Asahel? And he said— I am.

content: 21 Then Abner said to him— Turn thee aside､ to thy right hand､ or to thy left, and lay thee hold on one of the young men, and take thee his armour. But Asahel would not turn aside from pursuing him.
content_old: 21 Then Abner said to him— Turn thee aside､ to thy right hand､ or to thy left, and lay thee hold on one of the young men, and take thee his armour. But Asahel would not turn aside from pursuing him.

content: 22 And Abner said yet again unto Asahel, Turn thee aside from pursuing me,—wherefore should I smite thee to the earth? how then should I lift up my face unto Joab､ thy brother?
content_old: 22 And Abner said yet again unto Asahel, Turn thee aside from pursuing me,—wherefore should I smite thee to the earth? how then should I lift up my face unto Joab､ thy brother?

content: 23 Howbeit he refused to turn aside､ wherefore Abner smote him with the hinder end of the spear､ in the belly､ that the spear came out behind him, and he fell there､ and died on the spot,—and so it was､ that as many as came up to the place where Asahel fell and died stood still.

content_old: 25 And when the sons of Benjamin had gathered themselves together after Abner, and become one band,—and had taken their stand on the top of a certain hill

content: 26 then Abner cried aloud unto Joab､ and said— To the uttermost must the sword devour? Dost thou not well know that bitter shall it be､ in the latter end? How long､ then､ wilt thou not bid the people turn back from pursuing their own brethren?
content_old: 26 then Abner cried aloud unto Joab､ and said— To the uttermost must the sword devour? Dost thou not well know that bitter shall it be､ in the latter end? How long､ then､ wilt thou not bid the people turn back from pursuing their own brethren?

content: 27 Then said Joab— As God liveth surely if thou hadst not spoken then in the morning the people would of themselves have gone up､ every man from pursuing his brother.

content: 28 So Joab blew with the horn, and all the people stood still, and they neither pursued Israel further,—nor fought any more.
content_old: 28 So Joab blew with the horn, and all the people stood still, and they neither pursued Israel further,—nor fought any more.

To-day would I deal in lovingkindness with the house of Saul thy father､ towards his brethren､ and towards his friends, and have not delivered thee into the hand of David,—and yet thou hast charged upon me the transgression of the woman today.

content: 10 by turning over the kingdom from the house of Saul,—and establishing the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan､ even unto Beer-sheba.

content: 12 So Abner sent messengers unto David､ on the spot､ saying— Whose is the land? Saying also— Solemnise thy covenant with me; and lo! my hand shall be with thee, to bring round unto thee､ all Israel.
content_old: 12 So Abner sent messengers unto David､ on the spot､ saying— Whose is the land? Saying also— Solemnise thy covenant with me; and lo! my hand shall be with thee, to bring round unto thee､ all Israel.

content: 18 Now therefore､ act,—for Yahweh spake unto David､ saying, By the hand of David my servant will I save my people Israel､ out of the hand of the Philistines, and out of the hand of all their enemies.

content: 20 So when Abner came in unto David､ in Hebron, and with him twenty men David made､ for Abner､ and for the men who were with him a banquet.

content: 27 So Abner returned to Hebron, and Joab took him aside into the midst of the gate, to speak with him quietly,—and then smote him there､ in the belly, that he died､ for the blood of Asahel the brother of Joab.

content: 29 Let it be hurled upon the head of Joab, and against all his father’s house,—and let there not fail from the house of Joab—one that hath an issue､ or a leper､ or one that leaneth on a crutch､ or that falleth by the sword､ or that lacketh bread.
